title: Can I learn architecture online? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. learning architecture requires hands-on experience and interaction with others, students and professors, to get an internal, “three-dimensional” experience and skills in the field. some tools, like autocad, you can learn without this environment, but design is a complex and multi-layered skill and talent that can only be developed within a sequential studio environment. Even history, drawing, and other courses bring depth to designing for both building and urban environment cannot be learned online. I would suggest that even technical classes like mechanical and structural topics are best learned within a peer context where you share questions and processes.
Absolutely. Check out architecture courses on edx and coursera. My personal favorite course is the architectural imagination by Harvardx.
Most disciplines can be learnt online or through distant education but may be limited and not accredited by accrediting bodies if one has to qualify for registration.
